column4: anyone know why I can't open urls that start with an underscore?
i can do this on my windows box but not on my ubuntu machince
do you have an example? URL's normally don't start with underscore
I have a dev server that starts the url's with an underscore
like what?
ah, I see. I think it is actually allowed for subdomains to start with numbers, hyphen and even underscore
what is the error message?
it just cannot resolve the subdomain. Can you ping the testing.ourdomain.com server? Or even better, can you reach subdomains that do not start with underscore?
you think I have to add an entry to my host file?
that might be necessary. Test if you can ping the machine. (not the subdomain, because the webserver is 'serving' the subdomain)
hmm..
ok, so you may want to try to add the full info to /etc/hosts
that works, but there are potentially hundreds of sites that have that url format in our testing environment
I think I need to talk to our admins, to figure out why those are not resolving
yeah, I don't understand.
I *think* they should resolve..
and it just seem to be my linux box that is coughing at them, the windows and macs have no problems
that's a clue. There must be something that prevents linux to resolve. Maybe google knows something about that?
it's be hard to formulate a search string that returns anything useful
true. Something like "resolving subdomain underscore" maybe
comes up with this http://domainkeys.sourceforge.net/underscore.html
